|Item_parent_short=Infectious diarrhoea in adults and children
|Rank=A
|Title=Knowing the definition of a collective foodborne outbreak
|Description=See item 179
|Rubric=Definition
|Contributors=Johann Cailhol
|Order=15}}
See [[Health risks related to food and water. Food poisoning|item 179]]

question.question: What is the definition of a collective foodborne outbreak?
question.option_a: An outbreak that affects only one individual due to contaminated food.
question.option_b: A situation where multiple people experience similar symptoms after consuming the same contaminated food.
question.option_c: An outbreak that occurs in a specific geographic area but is not related to food consumption.
question.option_d: A widespread illness caused by contaminated water rather than food.
